intro: Cyclospermum uruguayense, commonly known as the Uruguay waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, wheel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along riverbanks. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
